meanings.definition: A dull, metallic sound made by two objects colliding.
meanings.sent1: The clunks of the pots woke up the entire house.
meanings.sent2: I heard the clunks of the hammer hitting the metal.
meanings.sent3: The clunks of the spoons in the drawer sounded like a tiny band.
meanings.sent4: The clunks of the old clock echoed through the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The clunks of the coins dropping into the jar were music to his ears.

meanings.definition: To make a dull, metallic sound.
meanings.sent1: The engine clunks loudly when starting up.
meanings.sent2: The door clunks shut behind him.
meanings.sent3: The old printer always clunks before printing a page.
meanings.sent4: His footsteps clunked on the wooden floor.
meanings.sent5: The tools clunked together in the toolbox as he carried it.

meanings.definition: A heavy, clumsy blow or movement.
meanings.sent1: The wrestler delivered a loud clunk to his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The clunk of the heavy box hitting the ground startled everyone.
meanings.sent3: The clunk of the falling tree branch made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The clunk of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the room.
meanings.sent5: The clunk of the door closing signaled the end of the day.
